document.docAuthor: Ferro, Gustavo Borges & Marshall, Stephen A.
document.docTitle: Paragrallomyia nodulosa Ferro & Marshall 2020, new species
document.masterDocTitle: A redefinition of Paragrallomyia Hendel (Diptera: Micropezidae, Taeniapterinae) and a revision of the P. albibasis complex

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A redefinition of Paragrallomyia Hendel (Diptera: Micropezidae, Taeniapterinae) and a revision of the P. albibasis complex

subSubSection.paragraph: Description: Body length 6 mm ; wing 4 mm . Head and abdomen dark brown, thorax black. Palpus dark brown except for white outer face. Clypeus dark brown with sparse pale microsetulae. First flagellomere dark brown. Fronto-orbital plate dark brown. Row of katepisternal setae brownish. Fore tibia dark brown. Fore tarsus mostly white, tarsomere one brown on basal quarter only. Hind femur mostly dark brown, narrowly white basally and with a small angled preapical white ring. Tergites dark brown. Oviscape mostly black, apex brown.

Thorax: Mesonotum with lines of thin brownish microsetulae. Anterior half of postpronotal lobe bare. Femur covered with sparse black microsetulae. Mid and hind tibia almost cylindrical, sulcus on outer face weak. Female cervical sclerite brown and smooth, not swollen on posterior end. Cell r 4+5 open at the tip of the wing.

Etymology: The specific name refers to the swollen dark spot anterior to the ocellar plate.

Comments:
Paragrallomyia nodulosa
is distinctive for the swollen black velvety spot anterior to the ocellar plate. The long and slightly curved arms of the copulatory fork and the single spermatheca with finger-like processes are also unusual.
